finalProject

Class Launcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • finalProject.Launcher

  • public class Launcher
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to perform the launching of the ball toward the goal once it has reached the forward line and is situated directly in front of the target. Based on the distance that is passed to the class the class will calculate how quickly the launching motor needs to move in order for the ball to be able to pass through the goal. The launcher then finds the angle to rotate to before accelerating to that speed and launching the ball. In addition, this class is used to receive the ball from the dispenser. The arm should be lowered to receive the ball and then after it has been received the bar should be placed to block the arm's upward motion and launcher arm should be released onto the bar to stop the strain on the battery.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Tristan Bouchard

    • Constructor Detail

      • Launcher

        public Launcher(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor LauncherMotor,
        EV3MediumRegulatedMotor BarMotor)
        Parameters:
        LauncherMotor - the motor used to move the launching arm
        BarMotor - the motor used to rotate the holding bar for the launching arm

    • Method Detail

      • Enter_Launch_Position

        public void Enter_Launch_Position()
        This should move the launch into a position where it can launch the ball. The arm should be pulled back, stretching the rubber bands and increasing the available energy to fire the ball.

      • lockArm

        public void lockArm()
        Should be called once the ball has been placed into the arm. The bar motor should be turned into position to hold the launch arm in place at which point the launching arm should be moved to be against the holding bar and then floated to reduce strain on the battery.

      • prepareToFire

        public void prepareToFire()
        This method should be called when the robot is in position to fire. The method should remove the bar arm and return the arm to its firing position.

      • Fire

        public void Fire(int dist)
        The overarching fire method, should call the other methods to get the speed and angle to fire from and then perform the actual action of rotating the arm and firing the ball.
        Parameters:
        dist - the distance to the goal in number of tiles

      • Calculate_Angle

        public static int Calculate_Angle(int dist)
        This method calculates the correct angle of release depending on the distance given.
        Parameters:
        dist - the distance to the goal in number of tiles.
        Returns:
        the angle to which the launching arm should rotate to fire the ball.

      • Calculate_Speed

        public static int Calculate_Speed(int dist)
        Calculates the speed at which the arm must rotate in order to reach the goal.
        Parameters:
        dist - the distance to the goal in number of tiles
        Returns:
        the speed at which the robot should rotate the launching arm to reach the target
